chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
l: list X
x: X

Goal:
{f : nat -> X | l = map f (list_an 0 (length l))}

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
length : forall A : Type, list A -> nat
map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> list A -> list B
map_ext_in_iff : map ?f ?l = map ?g ?l < -> (forall a : ?A, In a ?l -> ?f a = ?g a) where ?A : [X : Type l : list X x : X |- Type] ?B : [X : Type l : list X x : X |- Type] ?f : [X : Type l : list X x : X |- ?A -> ?B] ?g : [X : Type l : list X x : X |- ?A -> ?B] ?l : [X : Type l : list X x : X |- list ?A]
VectorDef.of_list : forall l0 : list ?A, VectorDef.t ?A (length l0) where ?A : [X : Type l : list X x : X |- Type]
VectorSpec.to_list_of_list_opp : forall l0 : list ?A, VectorDef.to_list (VectorDef.of_list l0) = l0 where ?A : [X : Type l : list X x : X |- Type]
seq = fix seq (start len : nat) {struct len} : list nat := match len with | 0 => nil | S len0 => start :: seq (S start) len0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments seq (_ _)%nat_scope
nat_bijection_Permutation : forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat), FinFun.bFun n f -> FinFun.Injective f -> let l := seq 0 n in map f l ~p l
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
Tauto.map_simpl : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A), map f l = match l with | nil => nil | a :: l0 => f a :: map f l0 end
map_eq_app : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (l1 l2 : list B), map f l = l1 ++ l2 -> exists l1' l2' : list A, l = l1' ++ l2' /\ map f l1' = l1 /\ map f l2' = l2
Permutation_nth_error_bis : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' < -> (exists f : nat -> nat, FinFun.Injective f /\ FinFun.bFun (length l) f /\ (forall n : nat, nth_error l' n = nth_error l (f n)))
map_app : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l l' : list A), map f (l ++ l') = map f l ++ map f l'
map_ext : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B), (forall a : A, f a = g a) -> forall l : list A, map f l = map g l
map_ext_in : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), (forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a) -> map f l = map g l
ext_in_map : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), map f l = map g l -> forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a
filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l < -> map f l = map g l
map_eq_cons : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (b : B), map f l = b :: l' -> exists (a : A) (tl : list A), l = a :: tl /\ f a = b /\ map f tl = l'
map_ext_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => f x = g x) l -> map f l = map g l
map_S_list_an : forall a n : nat, map S (list_an a n) = list_an (S a) n
map_cons : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (x : A) (l : list A), map f (x :: l) = f x :: map f l
map_eq_nil : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A), map f l = nil -> l = nil
Permutation_map_inv : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l1 : list B) (l2 : list A), l1 ~p map f l2 -> exists l3 : list A, l1 = map f l3 /\ l2 ~p l3
map_last : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (a : A), map f (l ++ a :: nil) = map f l ++ f a :: nil
Permutation_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> map f l ~p map f l'
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.N {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.I {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope
FinFun.bInjective = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x y : nat, x < n -> y < n -> f x = f y -> x = y : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bInjective _%nat_scope _%function_scope
map_rev : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A), map f (rev l) = rev (map f l)
map_map : forall (A B C : Type) (f : A -> B) (g : B -> C) (l : list A), map g (map f l) = map (fun x : A => g (f x)) l
Forall_image : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list B), Forall (fun y : B => exists x : A, y = f x) l < -> (exists l' : list A, l = map f l')
list_an_app_inv : forall (a n : nat) (l r : list nat), list_an a n = l ++ r -> l = list_an a (length l) /\ r = list_an (a + length l) (length r)
Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : VectorDef.t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n) Arguments VectorDef.t _%type_scope _%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.nil _%type_scope Arguments VectorDef.cons _%type_scope _ _%nat_scope
Permutation_nth_error : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' < -> length l = length l' /\ (exists f : nat -> nat, FinFun.Injective f /\ (forall n : nat, nth_error l' n = nth_error l (f n)))
FinFun.bFun = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x : nat, x < n -> f x < n : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bFun _%nat_scope _%function_scope
le_n_0_eq : forall n : nat, n <= 0 -> 0 = n
concat_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list (list A)), map f (concat l) = concat (map (map f) l)
firstn_all : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), firstn (length l) l = l
skipn : forall A : Type, nat -> list A -> list A
firstn : forall A : Type, nat -> list A -> list A
list_an_length : forall a n : nat, length (list_an a n) = n
length_zero_iff_nil : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), length l = 0 < -> l = nil
skipn_all : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), skipn (length l) l = nil
Permutation_nth : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A) (d : A), l ~p l' < -> (let n := length l in length l' = n /\ (exists f : nat -> nat, FinFun.bFun n f /\ FinFun.bInjective n f /\ (forall x : nat, x < n -> nth x l' d = nth (f x) l d)))

original: intros. exists (fun _ => x). apply Tauto.map_simpl. reflexivity.
